intro: Saurauia aequatoriensis var. boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian saurauia, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of Bolivia and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments at higher elevations. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in cloud forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists.
